Centre-ville Montréal, Québec, Canada, H3C 3J7 (fedex) 3423 (office), 2194 (main), or 3185 (LIGUM) Pavillon André-Aisenstadt 2920, chemin de la Tour Dept. I.R.O., Université de Montréal Montréal, Québec, Canada, H3T 1J4 Note on Retirement I am officially retired from my regular professor position since September 1st, 2025. I intend to remain active in research as an adjunct professor at DIRO until August 2028 (thereafter conditional to highly probable renewal). I will be physically at the office (at least) on Fridays. Other days, I am available through email/zoom/teams, but mostly early mornings, evenings, and weekends. I am still (and plan to continue) supervising M.Sc. students in research and internships, co-supervising Ph.D. students with colleagues, and participating on local committees (Predoc I, Predoc II, Defense) and external jurys. Although I would like to reduce my load of paper and grant evaluations, I can be contacted when they fall within my expertise. For the remaining days of the week, I am now finally involved in our company VYV, co-founded in 2004 with Martin Granger-Piché and Emric Epstein, two of my M.Sc. students.
